metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9776 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow leading to Heap buffer overflow in JBIG2Stream.cc inpdftocairo in Poppler before 0.56 allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impactvia a crafted PDF document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9776` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
libpoppler44 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
poppler-utils - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.24.5-2ubuntu4.7').
